August totals filed Tuesday from major super PACs include: Senate Leadership Fund: $28.2 million raised, $40.6 million on hand — Senate Majority PAC: $11.6 million raised, $12.2 million on hand — Independence USA PAC: $8.5 million raised, $5.7 million on hand — House Majority PAC: $7.1 million raised, $18.5 million on hand — League of Conservation Voters Victory Fund: $5.9 million raised, $8.6 million on hand — Freedom Partners Action Fund: $2.7 million raised, $2.9 million on hand.

FIRST IN SCORE — House internal polls show incumbents leading in one of each party's top pickup opportunities: Some had freshman Rep. Brad Ashford penciled in for a 2016 loss as soon as he got to Washington, and GOP Rep. Frank Guinta looked like he would lose his primary after his popularity dipped amidst a campaign finance scandal last year.

— Reform America Fund is out with an ad attacking Hillary Clinton in Wisconsin, saying that “C” is for “Clinton,” and for the “classified emails she’s hiding,” for “closet, where servers were hid,” and for “cough, that’s affecting her bid.” The spot is part of a $1.2 million buy in Milwaukee, Green Bay and Wausau cable markets, along with a radio and digital ad component.

— Other interesting donations include: The Oneida Indian Nation, which has feuded with NY-22 Republican Claudia Tenney and gave $500,000 to House Majority PAC; and Robert and Diana Mercer, who gave another $500,000 to an anti-John McCain super PAC in August before the senator won his primary in August, bringing their total spending against McCain to $700,000.

— GOP poll: Guinta 41, Shea-Porter 38 in NH-01: The New Hampshire congressman, who barely won his first post-scandal primary last week, has a slight edge (within the margin of error) over former Democratic Rep. Carol Shea-Porter in a new NRCC internal poll, 41 percent to 38 percent among registered voters.

— Democratic poll: Ashford 50, Bacon 40 in NE-02: The Nebraska Democrat leads GOP nominee Don Bacon 50 percent to 40 percent in his Omaha-based district, and Ashford holds a 50 percent approval rating among Republicans, according to a new survey from Global Strategy Group conducted for Ashford's campaign.

— MORE NEW POLLING — GOP poll: Fareed 46, Carbajal 43 in CA-24: Retiring Democratic Rep. Lois Capps' district has leaned Democratic in the past, but Republican Justin Fareed has followed up his July poll with another showing him with a slim advantage inside the margin of error.
